author: xtqqczze
body:
# PR Summary

Avoid variable names that conflict with automatic variables.

## PR Context

Variable names such as $error and $pid cause a PSScriptAnalyzer rule violation of type AvoidAssignmentToAutomaticVariable

comments.author: anmenaga
comments.body: @xtqqczze As far as i understand, this is a workaround for a problem in PSScriptAnalyzer, so it would be good to add an issue fro PSScriptAnalyzer for this.

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body:
@anmenaga I think this is expected behavior, as per [AvoidAssignmentToAutomaticVariable](https://github.com/PowerShell/PSScriptAnalyzer/blob/master/RuleDocumentation/AvoidAssignmentToAutomaticVariable.md) rule documentation.
> The variable $Error is an automatic variables that exists in the global scope and should therefore never be used as a variable or parameter name.
